snippet: American panel producers applauded a trade decision, but Chinese solar companies have already started to circumvent it.
abstract: American solar panel producers applaud United States International Trade Commission decision to uphold tariffs of about 24 to 36 percent on most panels imported from China; whether duties can help save US solar industry is matter of some dispute; Chinese firms have already started to circumvent it, and central problem of global oversupply remains.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: American panel producers applauded a trade decision, but Chinese solar companies have already started to circumvent it.

headline.main: Solar Tariffs Upheld, but May Not Help in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Solar Tariffs Upheld, but May Not Help in U.S.
